Revenant goblins are a type of monster that inhabit the Forinthry Dungeon along with all other revenants. The Forinthry Dungeon is a part of the Wilderness so it is possible to be attacked by other players here if opted into PvP.

Like all revenants, they can restore lifepoints quickly, can cure themselves of poison and react quickly to a player's protection prayers. When below 50% health, revenant goblins will "eat" to heal 1/6th their maximum lifepoints from their limited supply of food. For a full description of the healing mechanic see the revenants page.

Location[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Requirements Spawns Map
Forinthry Dungeon16-28None4Maplink

Drops[edit | edit source]

Drop rates estimated based on 52,107 samples from the Drop Log Project, unless otherwise cited.

Revenant drops are not affected by luck. There are only two ways to increase the drop rate of revenant items: completion of the elite Wilderness achievements which gives a 5% increased chance for revenant drops, and revenant drop enhancers, which give a 10% increased chance. Both boosts can be in effect at the same time.

Main drops[edit | edit source]

The ghostlevel used to calculate the drop rates of the level 16 revenant goblin's unique items is 4, and the revnumber is 15000.[1]

Graphical updates[edit | edit source]

  • Revenant goblin after 10 December 2007 (update)

    Revenant goblin after 10 December 2007 (update)

  • Revenant goblin after 1 July 2008 (update)

  • Revenant goblin after 17 October 2012 (update)

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • patch 17 April 2023 (Update):
    • Fixed the issue of incorrect souls being captured by Ushabti.
  • patch 11 April 2023 (Update):
    • Can be killed as part of the new undead slayer task.
  • patch 4 January 2011 (Update):
    • Fixed animations with the Revenant goblin.
  • patch 14 December 2010 (Update):
    • Revenant goblin heads no longer move strangely.
  • patch 25 August 2010 (Update):
    • Fixed the head models used by the Revenant goblins.
  • update 10 December 2007 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Revenant goblins used to have two different looks, with the variables being that they either had or hadn't had a helm and/or mohawk. After an update, Revenant goblins were updated and have a much more similar resemblance to their God Wars counterparts.
  • Revenant goblins are the third updated Revenant. The first was the Revenant dragon, and the second was the Revenant hobgoblin.
  • While in the Forinthry Dungeon, Revenant goblins had the second slowest respawn rate out of all of the revenants, only the Revenant vampyre having the slowest spawn rate. This was changed in an hidden update, which slightly increased their respawn rate.
